Description: A copper chisel: of approximately square section, slightly bent in the middle. The cutting edge is convex and has been hammered and ground from both sides.
Curator's comments: Petrie's dating of this chisel to the Old Kingdom ( 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), 31) would seem to be rather late, considering the form of the chisel and the level at which it was discovered. Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl. XV, 1. For other examples of Early Dynastic copper chisels, see E. Amélineau, ‘Les Nouvelles Fouilles d’Abydos’ II (1896-7), pl.XVIII; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, pl.XXXV, 91; XXXVIII, 94; XLI, 93; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' I (London, 1902), pl.L; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Abydos' II (London, 1902-4), pl.XV, 1, 8, 10; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tombs of the courtiers and Oxyrhynkos' (London, 1925), pl.V, 6, 8, 12; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tarkhan I and Memphis V' (London, 1913), pls.IV, 3-5, 8; VI, 4, 10; W. M. F. Petrie, 'Tools and weapons : illustrated by the Egyptian collection in University College, London' (London, 1917), 19-20 and pls.XXI-XXII; G. A. Reisner, 'The early dynastic cemeteries of Naga-ed-Dêr' I, (California, 1908), 115 and pl.40d; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' I' (Cairo, 1949), 42-6 and pl.9B; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' II' (London, 1954), 61 and pl.XXXIb; J. E. Quibell, ‘Archaic Objects’ (Cairo, 1905), nos. 14540-1. 14556-7 and pl.59; J. E. Quibell, 'Excavations at Saqqara, 1912-1914: Archaic Mastabas’ (Cairo, 1923), pl.VIII, 1; J. E. Quibell & F. W. Green, 'Hierakonpolis' II (London, 1989), 26 and pl.XLVIIIb; C. M. Firth and J. E. Quibell, 'Excavations at Saqqara : the Step Pyramid' II (Cairo, 1935), pl.93, (3); J. Garstang, ‘Maḥâsna and Bêt Khallâf’ (London, 1989), pls.XVI, XXIII; P. Montet, 'Kêmi' 8 (1946), pl.X.
Condition: The metal is slightly corroded but is in good condition.
